meanings.definition: The quality of being appropriate or fitting.
meanings.sent1: Her outfit had a certain patness that made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The patness of his response to the question impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The patness of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His choice of words had a patness that cut through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The patness of the solution to the problem was evident to everyone.

meanings.sent1: She always had a patness about her that made people smile.
meanings.sent2: His patness at the meeting caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The patness of his comment left everyone chuckling.
meanings.sent4: Her patness was like a ray of sunshine on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The patness of his humor brightened up the room.

meanings.definition: A quick, light tap or stroke.
meanings.sent1: He felt a gentle patness on his shoulder, and turned to see his friend.
meanings.sent2: The patness of her touch was comforting in that moment.
meanings.sent3: She added a playful patness to her dance moves, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The patness of the breeze against his face was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The patness of the kitten's paw on his hand was endearing.
